snippet: As North Carolina voters approved a ban on same-sex marriage this week, executives and business professors were silent on the issue; some say the state may regret the outcome.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column analyzes the theory that state bans on same-sex marriage are bad for business; notes that several prominent companies see bans as a recruitment disadvantage, limiting their ability to provide benefits to same-sex partners; warns that North Carolina's Fortune 500 corporations may regret not speaking out against the state's recent ban.
lead_paragraph: As North Carolina voters approved a ban on same-sex marriage this week, executives and business professors were silent on the issue; some say the state may regret the outcome.
